Ramai 'Bilateral' Gegara Fahri Sorot Jokowi
04 Nov 2019, 07:26 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Fahri Hamzah kembali mengkritik Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi). Kali ini, Jokowi kena kritik karena memakai istilah 'bilateral' saat bertemu Presiden FIFA Gianni Infantino.
Pertemuan Jokowi dengan Gianni digelar di sela-sela KTT ASEAN yang digelar di Bangkok, Thailand. Jokowi membahas penunjukan Indonesia sebagai tuan rumah Piala Dunia U-20 tahun 2021.
"Pertemuan bilateral dengan Presiden FIFA Gianni Infantino di Bangkok. Terima kasih atas penunjukan Indonesia menjadi tuan rumah Piala Dunia U-20 tahun 2021. Sebagai tuan rumah, Indonesia menyambut baik jika Tim Pendahulu FIFA datang untuk berkoordinasi dengan PSSI," kata Jokowi dalam akun Twitternya, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
Cuitan Jokowi yang memakai istilah 'bilateral' kemudian disoroti warganet, termasuk Fahri. Mereka berpadangan konteks bilateral adalah pertemuan antara 2 negara. Sementara, FIFA adalah federasi sepak bola dan bukan merupakan negara.
"Setahu saya istilah bilateral itu hanya untuk negara. FIFA bukan negara kan? Wallahualam," kata Fahri lewat Twitter, Sabtu (2/11).



Jika merujuk Kamus Besar Bahasa Indonesia (KBBI) dari Kementerian Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan, pengertian bilateral (bi.la.te.ral /bilatêral) adalah 'dari dua belah pihak; antara dua pihak'. Namun tidak disebutkan secara spesifik apakah konteks bilateral sebatas pertemuan antar 2 negara atau bisa meluas maknanya.

Crowded 'Bilateral' Gegara Fahri Highlights Jokowi
Nov 04 2019, 07:26 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Fahri Hamzah again criticized President Joko Widodo (Jokowi). This time, Jokowi was criticized for using the term 'bilateral' when meeting FIFA President Gianni Infantino.
Jokowi's meeting with Gianni was held on the sidelines of the ASEAN Summit which was held in Bangkok, Thailand. Jokowi discussed the appointment of Indonesia as the host of the 2021 U-20 World Cup.
"Bilateral meeting with FIFA President Gianni Infantino in Bangkok. Thank you for the appointment of Indonesia to host the U-20 World Cup in 2021. As host, Indonesia welcomes the FIFA Predecessor Team to come to coordinate with PSSI," Jokowi said in his Twitter account. , Saturday (2/11/2019).
Jokowi's cuit using the term 'bilateral' was then highlighted by citizens, including Fahri. They based on bilateral context is a meeting between two countries. Meanwhile, FIFA is a soccer federation and is not a country.
"As far as I know, the bilateral term is only for countries. FIFA is not a country, right? God knows," Fahri said via Twitter, Saturday (11/11).



If referring to the Big Indonesian Dictionary (KBBI) from the Ministry of Education and Culture, the bilateral understanding (bi.la.te.ral / bilatêral) is' from two parties; between the two parties'. However, it did not specify whether the bilateral context was limited to a meeting between two countries or could expand its meaning.
